  • Phantomas Saga: Infinity
title: CEZ Collection: Vol. 1

description:
Gates to Hell is a 2D platform game set in the near future with bright and colourful graphics. A few old computer gurus have learned about Bill Gates's goal to alienate humanity with a new computer operating system: Windows to Hell (W2H). The player's character is an Amstrad user who has been recruited to infiltrate the Microsoft facility and infect the central computer with a dangerous virus to destroy all source code.

The game consists of more than 150 screens divided over three levels. They are single-screen rooms connected both horizontally and vertically to form a large environment using the flip-screen mechanic with an amount of freedom to explore. The player's character can only move around and jump while avoiding enemies such as snakes, parrots, bats, arrows, killer monitors and hazards such as dangerous drop of liquid.

The first level starts in the forest where the company's bunker needs to be located. A key will be required to get in through the entrance. In the second level the central computer needs to be infected. Other computers have already been targeted, but not the central ones. The character has a health meter and in this level there are a few Z80 computers that can be picked up to restore some health. In the third level W2H is destroyed, but the character still needs to exit the facility. There is a countdown with time pressure and many traps to avoid. When all health is gone, the game is over. The game has exploration with some minor environment based puzzling with keys, lever and computer terminals.
title: Gates to Hell

description: Aqua is a 2D game somewhat similar to the concept of Bubble Ghost. The player controls an air bubble and needs to safely guide it to the surface. Starting underwater there are 20 levels or single screen rooms that need to be completed. Once the bubble starts to move it keeps moving at a steady speed, so the player constantly needs to adjust the movement as it is not possible to hold still completely anymore until the next screen is reached. Along the way typical underwater elements need to be avoided such as rocks, walls, crabs, fishes and so on. The bubble has a health meter and every collision removes a part of it.
title: Aqua

description:
Platform Medley Block #1 is a 2D game starring Mari Stormbringer. She works as a cashier in the L.E.S.S. supermarket which is about to go bankrupt because there are hardly any customers. Mari is terribly bored at work and due to a series of events involving n&n's candy and alkaline batteries her brain gets affected by radioactivity and she ends up in an alternate 2D dimension with brick-like pixels. The player has to help bring her back to the real world.

The game has a bright and colour world. It consists of several single-screen rooms connected both horizontally and vertically using the flip-screen mechanic with an amount of freedom to explore. Mari has fifteen lives and she needs to complete platforming sections, dodge a wide variety of enemies and avoid hazards such as spikes. When she comes in contact with an enemy or a hazard a life is lost. She has no means to attack.
title: Platform Medley Block #1

description:
Phantomas 2.0 is an unofficial remake of the 1986 game Vampire, which was the sequel to the 1986 ZX Spectrum game released in the same year: Phantomas. Unlike the UK version of the 1986 game which introduced the character Brok the Brave, the remake stars the original protagonist from the Spanish version: Phantomas. He is an android thief and was captured during his last mission on the Earth-Gamma planet in the first game where he stole treasure from a millionaire's mansion. This time he has a mission on Earth as he ventures into the castle of Count Dracula to defeat him and bring back order and peace to the region. This remake closely mirrors the original game with the original challenges, design, enemies and level lay-out. The largest changes are in the entirely new visual design and art, tweaked elements, new music and improved responsiveness.

The player controls Phantomas through different rooms of the castle. Those are all single screens linked together both horizontally and vertically offering an amount of freedom to explore freely. Phantomas has no means to attack and he needs to complete platforming sections avoiding enemies, traps and hazards. He starts with one life and can earn additional ones by picking up pieces of chicken. Several sections are locked and first require a key. To confront Count Dracula himself three weapons need to be gathered first: a cross, a hammer and a stake. There are also six shutters that need to be opened so the sunlight is brought in to weaken Dracula. The castle consists of different environment with regular rooms, a roof section and catacombs. Several additional items and gameplay mechanics are revealed while playing.
title: Phantomas 2.0

description:
Galaxia is a horizontally scrolling shoot-em-up, where your jet battles 10 waves of space nasties on an alien planet. Each wave or level lasts for about 10 seconds, during which time hordes of creatures of a specific type traverse the screen from right to left. The earliest waves are populated with relatively harmless Rammers, followed by more erratically moving Mushys and Spiders and eventually highly mobile Swoopers which can shoot and the very fast moving Baiters. Contact with the aliens or their projectiles will cause you to lose one of your jets. Shooting them gives you points, with the more dangerous aliens being worth more.

After the ten waves of nasties have been avoided, a starship appears which moves with a fairly unpredictable vibrating motion. Directly touching the nose of your ship to the exact centre of the back of the starship allows you to dock to earn bonus points. However even a narrow miss will cause your jet to explode. After the starship disappears, the colour of the screen changes and you loop back to the Rammers at a slightly faster speed.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Rammers move faster the third time round.

title: Galaxia

description:
Chronicles of Nanako is a mail order compilation on a double sided tape. It contains two games by the Spanish development group The Mojon Twins. Both games were previously available for free, but are here bundled as fully remastered versions including enhanced gameplay and improved graphics. These new versions are only available through this release. The included games are:* Nanako Descends to Hell

  • Nanako in Classic Japanese Monster Castle
title: Chronicles of Nanako

description: In the distant future, the continued existence of the human race is in grave danger. Uncanny diseases, which were previously unknown, are rampant among humans and claim many victims. The plant world mutated and for unknown reasons, a deadly green carpet grows over the land. Fear and terror prevail among the already decimated humanity. It seems as if nature has conspired against man and is now striving to wipe him from the face of the earth for good. A small group of survivors saves themselves on a secluded island in the Saragossa-Sea, where life is still possible without dangers and dangers. There the refugees discover the remains of a lost culture. An ancient prophecy has been engraved on the stone tablets, which tells of a blue crystal whose mysterious power could save mankind from destruction. But the only clue to the place where this crystal is said to be is a clue to an underground temple. This chance, however small it may be, must of course not go unused. And so the strongest, bravest and most intelligent is chosen. Thus begins an adventurous odyssey above and below the lonely island, in the vastness of the mysterious Saragossa-Sea.
title: Der Blaue Kristall

description: The game goal is to "locate the brain within a maze and destroy it with a bomb". You control a little helicopter and you can pick up objects to use in certain sections of the maze. There's a lot of teleporting to be done and it's easy to get trapped, and you'll also need a pen and paper to note the codes for the teleport stations.
title: Flyspy

description:
Roland in Space is a 2D scrolling platform game where you play a lord of time who must travel to seven different planets and collect the 158 components of the ARNOLD super-weapon. Once complete, this weapon will allow Roland to defeat the evil Maestro and save the universe. The game is a direct sequel to Roland in Time and has similar game-play and mechanics.

The player can choose which of the seven worlds they wish to explore from the planet screen. Roland then appears from out of his phone-box like space-ship on the selected planet and can start collecting weapon pieces, represented by flickering blue orbs. Roland can move around the screen using left, right and jump keys. Other keys allow you to scroll the screen independently of moving the character. The landscape is odd in that some of it allows Roland to walk and jump through it and prevents him falling. Some other areas will collapse under him as soon as he walks on it, and there are even invisible semi-solid areas that slow Roland's rate of fall, but will allow him to gain height by continually jumping.

Roland starts the game with nine regenerations, but these will easily be lost to fast moving enemies, inconveniently placed traps and falls from reasonable heights. Once all of the weapon fragments on a planet have been collected, the screen flashes. At any time, Roland can return to his phone-box and so back to the planet screen. The collected weapon parts do not re-spawn when the planet is visited again, but the rest of the level does refresh.
title: Roland in Space

description:
The Amstrad version of D-Day takes the same approach as Futura's other versions of D-Day by being a multi-genre game comprising of four different missions. While the idea of the missions are similar how they are done is different.

  1. The plane missions have been replaced with missions from the Naval simulation game Advanced Destroyer Simulator.

  2. Paratrooper - players select paratroopers one at a time and issue them orders as they contend with the wind. Orders include inclined flight to the left or right and accelerated or normal descent.

  3. Infantry - In this part of the game, players take on the command of an allied infantry unit as they complete 20 missions in order to gain a strong position in enemy territory. The allied unit the player issues orders to consists of anywhere between 3 to 10 soldiers that are based on a French infantry units. The soldiers can use rifles, grenades, and can also use mortar fire to attack enemy fortifications, but they have to keep a careful eye on not wasting ammo as it can run out.

  4. Tank - The missions are from Sherman M4.
title: D-Day

description: The CPC version of Short Circuit is similar to the ZX Spectrum version. However the adventure portion of the game features a smaller map. The rooms, objects, and puzzles have also been altered.
title: Short Circuit

description:
Conflicts 1 is a collection of three strategy war games:

  • Battle of Britain
  • Theatre Europe
  • Tobruk
title: Conflicts 1

description:
La crypte des maudits (The Cursed Crypt) is a French first-person adventure game and the follow-up to the 1990 CPC title La secte noire. In the first game a dwarf stranger managed to dismantle the demonic organization La secte noire who terrorized Issegeac, a quiet little village in the Périgord Noir in France. In this sequel survivors of the sect have returned and they are now gathered in the castle of Golin the gnome. The terrified villagers go looking for the kind stranger again and they find him in a forest. He returns to the castle to deal with the sect.

As in the first game it consists of several single-screen rooms. The environment takes up the largest portion of the screen in the top left part, a character is on the right, the text parser where all commands are entered is at the bottom and a compass is in the bottom right. Basic commands are entered for moving around, picking up items and performing actions. Below the parser portion sentences appear to provide descriptions or feedback on the player's actions.

The game supports saving and loading, but not in the third and final part.
title: La crypte des maudits

description:
La secte noire (The Black Sect) is a French first-person adventure game. It takes place in Issegeac, a quiet little village in the Périgord Noir in France, that is terrorized by a dark sect. The player is a dwarf stranger who appears to help the villagers by retrieving a magical tome the sect has stolen.

The game consists of several single-screen rooms exploring the village and its surroundings. The environment takes up the largest portion of the screen in the top left part, there is fantasy artwork on the right and the text parser where all commands are entered is at the bottom. Basic commands are entered for moving around, picking up items and performing actions. Below the parser portion sentences appear to provide descriptions or feedback on the player's actions.

The game supports saving and loading.
title: La secte noire

description:
Mokowe is a French first-person adventure game taking place in Kenya's Mokowé settlement in May 1975. The player is a brave adventurer contacted by professor Wilson part of a group to protect elephants. Mokowé's local police contacted the professor about a network of poachers killing elephants systematically. The main character jumps on a plane to assist with the operation right away.

The game uses mechanics similar to the author's previous title La secte noire. The game consists of several single-screen locations with exploration, picking up and using objects to solve puzzle and conversations with characters. The environment takes up the largest portion of the screen in the centre with a permanent background behind it. The top left corner shows possible movement options based on compass points. The top also holds boxes for the current date and time. The text parser where all commands are entered is at the bottom. Basic commands are entered for moving around, picking up items and performing actions. A separate key is used to display the inventory. Below the parser portion sentences appear to provide descriptions or feedback on the player's actions.

A distinctive game element is the role of the time of day. Certain actions can be only be performed during the day or at night. One of the possible actions is "attendre" (wait) to make time pass. The game can be saved on a separate disk.
title: Mokowe

description:
There has been an earthquake at the local nuclear reactor, and the coolant lines have sprung leaks. Only one man can fix the leaks and prevent disaster. A man with a spanner... Spannerman!

Spannerman is a single screen arcade platform game, where you must dash around the screen repairing leaks in coolant pipes. These pipes do not stay fixed, and may need to be revisited if they are not tightened sufficiently. While conducting your handy-man activities, you must avoid hazards including falling debris knocked loose by the earthquake, and rising water levels. On the above water decks, there may also be mutant anti-matter mice which can be kicked away if you get your timing right. A failed kick will give the rats an opportunity to deliver a fatal bite.

Under water decks may be visited for a short period of time, but you only have just over a minute's worth of oxygen which can be replenished above the water. Once the water has reached the top of the screen, there is no way to avoid death. Each time spannerman dies, the level starts again from the beginning.

sample_screenshots.caption: Start of game. No leaks yet.
Spannerman's soul ascending after being killed by falling debris.
A radioactive rodent patrols the last dry deck.

title: Spannerman

description:
This compilation contains the following games:* Galivan

  • Knight Rider
  • Miami Vice
  • Short Circuit
  • Street Hawk
  • Top Gun
title: 6 Super Hits pour Amstrad

description:
Danger Street is an arcade game set in New York 2017, a superb city filled with most infamous criminals in the entire galaxy. The highest council of New York has decided to finish it once and for all and massively eliminate these scums. The player is the vigilante of the future, who must rid the city of all these decadent beings. New York is counting on you!

So, the player should shoot the enemies appearing on the screen and shooting at you with an aiming crosshair while scrolling the street from left to right. Once all the enemies are eliminated on the level, the player is transferred to the next level gaining the scores and the bonus. There is no health bar, and it is only one life for the player.
title: Danger Street

description: Profanation is an action game, where the player controls a fearless adventurer on his way to the mystical doors leading to hell. Entering a devilish castle with his only friend, a superb rifle, the adventurer should find a door on the level, collecting the treasures and eliminating their guardians such as bats, blobs of slime, zombies, insects and giant flies. The found door transfers the adventurer to the next level. When the adventurer is collided with an enemy, he is transferred to the most recent stored position on the level without one of his lives. Losing all the lives leads to the end of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Seeing the bugs in the distance
Going down with a faithful rifle

title: Profanation

description: Buggy II is an off-road racing arcade game, where the player is driving across the desert full of different obstacles controlling his buggy. Before the buggy runs out of fuel, it needs to find a finish line using the turn signals. The obstacles include the canisters and holes with bridges. Collision with a canister means the car's explosion, and it is possible to use the bumps to jump over them. But the jumps decrease the car's fuel reserves, which may be refueled passing through white poles, and it affects the bonus at the finish. Highest scores are stored in the Top 7 table.

sample_screenshots.caption: The buggy was blown up after the collision (in French)

title: Buggy II

description: Python is a Snake variant, where the player controls a snake in labyrinths with scattered food. Each time the snake eats food, it grows, and it must avoid hitting its tail with its head. The food gives points, but there is a time limit to complete each level.
title: Python

description: Galachip is a Galaxian clone in French replicating the gameplay of the original with an ability for the player's ship to move slightly up and down. The highest scores are stored in a top 7 table.
title: Galachip

sample_screenshots.caption: "Which way Mack" has strange flags and two trains.
"Henry said history is bunk" features bats.
Starting a new game. Navigate the scout ship through the asteroid belt to the landing pads on the planet below.
Successfully landed on the 4x point landing pad.
Your ship has multiple weapon types.
Strange new types of aliens attack.

description: Cheops is an animated graphic adventure game for the Amstrad CPC 464. It is 2300BC and you are an Egyptian brigand trying to break your way into the Pharoah's tomb. Players get to explore over 300 chambers between the two pyramids. Guide your character through the mazes of Cheops using text input.
title: Cheops

description:
Karl has won first prize in a quiz, which is a weekend stay at Wonga mansion. On arrival, he finds himself in a maze of 40 surreal rooms containing platforms, miscellaneous hazards and a collectable key in each room.

Karl's Treasure Hunt is a platform game and a sequel to Karls Kavern for the BBC Micro. It is clearly inspired by Jet Set Willy in its gameplay and the same sort of oddly named rooms with unusual and obscure occupants moving in strangely regimented patterns. Karl may be moved left or right, or may jump. Contact with many objects in the room or falling from a modest height will result in the loss of one of an initial five lives. To escape and win a treasure, Karl must visit each and room and pick up the key before eventually making his way to the exit.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Rubik's cube is a most fiendish enemy.
A vicious pair of spectacles patrols the room.
Title screen. Text running across the top of the screen gives game information.

title: Karl's Treasure Hunt

description:
It is 1994, and the entire Earth has been invaded by aliens... almost. You control Macho, helicopter pilot extraordinaire, as he flies around the screen collecting the parts for the nine fighter planes whose assembly is Earth's last desperate hope.

Chopper Squad is a game similar to Jetpac, where you must avoid alien nasties, collect parts of a plane that appear around the screen, and bring them back to an assembly point. The screen contains only three helicopter landing pads, and an assembly zone accessed by moving a carried plane part into the bottom right side of the screen. The helicopter can move left or right, and increase altitude. When not directly moving upwards, the copter slowly descends.

The copter is also equipped with a "photon proton lazer blazer" with which to destroy enemies. Enemies can also be destroyed if they touch the top or the bottom of the screen. Vanquished enemies will be re-spawned from off-screen so that there are always four at any time. Aliens on earlier levels move about randomly, while later ones move more quickly and home in on your position.

Plane components occasionally fall from the sky, with only one appearing at any given time. Once all of the plane pieces have been placed in the assembly area, the next level starts. The player starts with 4 lives, which can be lost on collision with an alien. Loss of all lives ends the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 3. Aliens head straight for you!

title: Chopper Squad

description:
Defend or Die is a clone of the Williams arcade classic Defender.

The player's spacefighter is flying over the jagged planetary landscape on a mission to protect the humanoids from evil alien landers. The player patrols the two-way scrolling landscape in his ship, disposing of six different types of aliens preventing them from abducting the humans. If the aliens manage to get a human to outer space (top of the screen), it mutates and takes after you. You can rescue the humanoid by shooting the alien capturing it, but if it falls too far it will meet its end. In that case you need to swoop in to pick it up and return it safely to the surface. At the end of level, each surviving human gives you a bonus score.

Your ship is equipped with lasers and a limited number of smart bombs and the the top of the screen is dedicated to a long range scanner that shows the location of all enemies and humanoids on the level.

You start out with three lives. Each time you get hit by an enemy or an projectile you lose a live, once all lives are spent the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: The enemies have picked up the humans.

title: Defend or Die

description:
A collection of two arcade game clones, previously only available for the BBC Micro.

  • Killer Gorilla a clone of the Nintendo arcade classic Donkey Kong

  • Gauntlet a clone of the Williams arcade classic Defender
title: Killer Gorilla / Gauntlet

description:
6 Computer Hits is a compilation of the following six games:

  • 3D Starstrike
  • Battle Through Time
  • The Covenant
  • Gauntlet
  • Jack And The Beanstalk
  • Killer Gorilla
title: 6 Computer Hits

description:
5 Computer Hits is a compilation of the following five games:

  • 2112AD
  • Attack of the Killer Tomatoes
  • Contraption
  • Kettle
  • Wizard's Lair
title: 5 Computer Hits

description:
Aliens have invaded your spacecraft. For the good of humanity, you have decided to stop the aliens by destroying your ship. However the pieces needed to activate the self-destruct sequence have been scattered around your vessel. Your task is to collect all 12 explosive parts, assemble and activate them in the correct part of the ship, and then flee to the life-boat in the hope that you will eventually be rescued.

Argo Navis is a platform game set in a 96-room maze, connected by corridors and ramps. You can walk left or right, shoot, or jump over small gaps. You start the game with a certain amount of oxygen, which only decreases if you fall any distance, run into walls, or get hit by aliens (such as robot guards, spitters and weird spider-like creatures). Oxygen cylinders may be collected to replenish your air.

As you explore the ship, you will find that many areas can only be accessed by pressing a button to activate a door, and there is some challenge in determining which order the doors should be opened. You may find stars to collect which increases your score. There is also a mini-game which is accessed any time you try to pass one of the special red firing portals dotted around the ship. When this happens, the ship comes under attack by another alien ship and you must move your cross-hair about to shoot at it. Once that ship has been obliterated, the game continues as normal.

sample_screenshots.caption: Mini-game when activating the red firing portal.
Just used a teleporter from the top of the screen.

title: Argo Navis

description:
E.X.I.T is a surreal point-and-click adventure game in French that takes you through time and space. The game environment displayed through a first-person perspective takes up about a third of the screen and it is shown in a rectangle in the top right part of the screen. On the left side there are three buttons that can be clicked (by moving a cursor shaped as a hand) to interact. Near the top left is the inventory.

The main goal is figuring out a way to repair the space ship after being stranded on a planet. There is no linear path to follow and right from the start there is freedom of exploration. Progressing involves locating pieces and solving puzzles. Eventually a second, very different part of the game is reached with action sequences, puzzles with 2D-scrolling elements as well as navigating a 3D environment with real-time movement.
title: E.X.I.T

description: Palitron is an action puzzle game controlling a robot. In several single-screen environments linked together the robot needs to locate sixteen crystals. The robot can freely be moved around in four direction, there is a jump button as levels have vertical elements with platforms, and there are keys to activate items in the environment, pick up objects and drop them. Red robots that resemble mushrooms need to be avoided and batteries are used to maintain energy. Level elements include pits that drop the robot several levels, teleportation titles and one-way doors.
title: Palitron

description:
This compilation contains nine previously released games:

  • Fairlight
  • Fairlight II
  • Shadow Skimmer
  • Palitron
  • Mindstone
  • Inside Outing (a.k.a. Raffles / Devon Aire in the Hidden Diamond Caper)
  • Brian Bloodaxe
  • Bobby Bearing

  • Warlock

  • Plus a demo of Garfield - Big Fat Hairy Deal
title: All-Stars

description:
The Triple Decker collections combine three previously-released games, with different lineups on each system, and one game taking precedence over the other two. This set contains:

  • Snodgits
  • Pentomania - a puzzle game involving arranging shapes into a space by rotating and mirroring them to ensure that the area can be filled perfectly
  • Hi-Rise - Bill must paint a high-rise building while fending off striking workers, who are trying to stop him by flinging paint at them.
title: Triple Decker 2

description:
Contamination is a world health simulation game, where the earth is invaded by unknown viruses from outer space.

The player takes on the role of the World Health Center tasked with identifying the virus, creating an antidote and taking other measures to stop the virus from spreading. At the same time the player must not wear down morale of the world population, or risk a up-rising by the local population. When the population is out of control, it becomes impossible to order measures like a sanitary belt.

The player must first take a sample of an infected region, then create an anti-virus by grabbing all the virus parts in a certain order. Next is the experimentation phase, to determine the probable effect of treatment but also the secondary observed effects. An antidote can have side effects such as dehydration, liquidation of the eyes, cancer of the lungs etc. When you treat the population with a highly toxic anti-virus with severe side effects the population reacts negatively.

Other measures include a stop icon to put a sanitary belt in place, a fire icon to perform a terre brulee or scorched earth. The ultimate measure is to simply drop a nuclear explosion on a region, which results in an instant game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choose which program to run on the virus sample
The recapitulation screen, status of the virus infections so far
The virus is spreading, this isn't going well
Select difficulty level: novice or responsible

title: Contamination

description: Splatch! is a Boulder Dash clone originally released as a type-in program in the Amstrad Computer User magazine. You control a rabbit who must navigate underground levels to find carrots to eat. Digging through the dirt can release rocks which will fall and can crush the rabbit. There are other obstacles such as mushrooms and on later levels moving opponents which are deadly to encounter.

sample_screenshots.caption: Move the rabbit through the level and try to eat all the carrots.

title: Splatch!

description:
Star Avenger is a variant of the arcade game Scramble . You control a spaceship travelling across a horizontally scrolling landscape littered with obstacles of various types including missiles, planes, bats and force-fields. In some areas, the ceiling and floor topography also means careful piloting is needed to avoid a crash. Your aim is to make it past everything without hitting anything. Points can be earned by shooting some of the opponents.

You have an energy gauge, which starts full but is depleted at a constant rate. Running out of fuel will lose a life, but shooting fuel tanks will replenish some of the lost energy. There is only one big level which repeats once you reach and destroy a reactor at the end. However you can start the game at any of a number of checkpoints. There is also a difficulty setting which may be selected (from 1-5) and affects the speed of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Start the game from any of these checkpoints.

title: Star Avenger

sample_screenshots.caption: The fighter's face gets bloodied as they take a beating.

description:
Tie Break is a French tennis simulation where you compete in the Roland Garros tennis tournament that uses a diagonal-down perspective.

You can play against AMSTRAD (computer AI) or another player on the same computer, or you can select DEMO for a demonstration of the game. There are two modes to choose from: The automatic mode where you hit the ball by placing the player in front of it or the manual mode where you need to press the ACTION key to hit the ball.

The game also allows you to set the difficulty level when playing against the computer, whether you want to play one, two or three sets to win the match and choose from three court surfaces. (grass, clay, and synthetic)

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting the service against the AMSTRAD.

title: Tie Break

description:
Action Pack is a compilation that contains:

  • Blagger
  • Defend or Die
  • Electro Freddie
  • Darts
title: Action Pack

description:
You and your videogame-addicted friend have been beamed into a game. You must kill him (in this world) within a set time - not too late, but also not too quickly.

Voodoo Rage is an action game made up of 20 single screen levels, with the player starting at the top. The killing can be done using one of your ten Voodoo Rage attacks (which last for 10 seconds each, an extra one is earned for 10,000 points), or by collecting a rolling pin and using it on him. Either way, you must navigate platform and avoid floating monsters.
title: Voodoo Rage

description: Lala: The Magical is a new and improved version of the original Lala: Prologue released in 2010. While the core game is likely identical, the graphics have been vastly reworked with a much brighter palette using a new engine.
title: Lala: The Magical

description:
La Chose de Grotemburg is a text adventure with graphics in French. The protagonist returns to his town after travelling to find his young wife dead. The search for the one responsible bring the character to different locations such a forest, an underground environment and a mansion where the one responsible resides.

Most of the screen provides a view of the environment with detailed graphics. At the bottom of the screen text descriptions appear and commands are entered. On the right possible movement options based on the four wind directions are displayed.
title: La Chose de Grotemburg

description:
Death Pit is a 2D scrolling platform game where you play as a treasure hunter, setting off on an underground expedition to recover gold and a priceless gem. The aim is to get as high a score as possible. Points are earned by finding valuables below ground, and returning them to your tent near the entrance of the pit.

To survive the caverns, you will need a battery to power your torch and an oxygen cylinder to pass through water filled corridors. These slowly deplete with use, but you can carry back-ups (up to 4 items max) and fully charged replacements may be found on the surface. You may also carry a spade, which is needed to menace some of the creepy-crawlies that scuttle about the depths.

There are twenty gold bars randomly scattered through the subterranean regions, but the gem is always in the same position. The game ends once a timer runs out, you have lost five lives or have returned to your tent with the gem.

sample_screenshots.caption: Your tent, near the entrance to the Death Pit.
Water covers some of the caverns.

title: Death Pit

description:
Darts is a traditional darts simulation game using the classic darts rules, where you and your opponent compete with each other for a score of 501 points or 301 points on a best out of three sets and finishing on a double or a bull. Very simple looking, the game displays your score and your opponent's score. You can choose the 501 or 301 mode by pressing F1.

To aim and to fire the dart use the joystick, then the player needs to put the cursor on the screen, but the aim isn't precise, it moves around and is purposely hard to control, so its necessary some skill to fire at the right time on the board. Like classic darts game, the dart can hit outside of the board and in the wire, meaning no points for you or your opponent.

It is also part of a compilation of games titled "Pub Games" for the same platform (Amstrad CPC) and from the same year (1986).

sample_screenshots.caption:
Darts different screen from Pug Games compilation. 
Back then, it was possible to be played with CTM644 Colour Monitor., which came with Amstrad CPC.

Darts different screen from Pub Games compilation.
Back then, it was also possible to be played with GT65 Green Monitor, which came with Amstrad CPC.

Darts board screen.
This one features the 501 game mode on screen.

Darts Main Menu screen.
Press Fire To Start.

Darts board points screen.
3 darts were thrown here, setting a new score.

title: Darts

description:
10 Computer Hits 3 is a compilation that includes the following ten games:

  • Herbert's Dummy Run
  • Hi Rise
  • On The Run
  • Devils Crown
  • Wriggler
  • Dynamite Dan
  • Elidon
  • Juggernaut
  • Geoff Capes Strongman Challenge
  • Cauldron
title: 10 Computer Hits 3

description: Black Land is a homebrew roleplaying game for the Amstrad CPC In this game you control a party of 4 members trying to save the world by recovering 4 gems to stop an evil wizard. The game is played mainly in an isometric view for exploring and combat. The combat is turn based. There is an overworld top down view to travel between localizations.
title: Black Land

description: Two players fight against each other. You try to find a tank and you need gas and some ammunition for your tank. You should also find all pots with the chars from the password. With all chars you have to decode the password and destroy the headquarter of your enemy. You'll also find beepers to open gates, smart bombs (to kill the other player), mines and rockets. You'll also need something to eat or drink and watch out for the gas of your tank!
title: Alien Tank Attack

description:
Jet Paco for Amstrad CPC is the fourth iteration of Jet Paco. It builds on the previous games in the series, but is not identical. The siblings Paco and Puri Rebollez are astronauts and their job is to gather energonia crystals, a material used to power spaceships. They get around using a jetpack. In this version of the game they detect an abandoned ship and investigate to look for crystals. Players get to choose between Paco or Puri at the start and there are three missions in total.

The missions consist of several single-screen rooms connected vertically and horizontally so there is free exploration to collect the crystals in any order. The characters can fly around with an unlimited amount of fuel using a jet pack. Movement is based on thrust, so the player can either keep a button pressed to keep rising or use small taps to hover and navigate small passages. Unlike the previous games they cannot fly through platforms when approaching them from below. There are hazards and enemies in irregular patterns to avoid. The characters have no means to attack, the focus is on careful navigation using the jet pack mechanic. The HUD shows how many crystals are left to be found.
title: Jet Paco

description:
An early golfing game on the Amstrad CPC and exclusive to the system, this is a one player game where the player is challenged to take on 18 hole golf course from an overhead point of view that switches to a 2D one for some pressure shots.

The aim is to get around the courses in as few strokes as possible to improve your handicap, avoiding sand traps, rough grass and water features. Improving your handicap will result in longer and more accurate shots on your next round.

The game has a password system to allow players to continue to work on lowering their handicap over several sessions.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lining up the perfect shot on the green
A bad start on the second but we've avoided the lake at least

title: Amsgolf

description:
Roland on the Run is an entry in the Roland series of games. This time it sees our hero and his gang trying to escape the law by leaping from the back of a moving train and cross the busy freeway to safety. Jumping from truck to car, to truck, the player takes control of a flashing member of the gang which can and will quickly change focus as they all look to get moving away.

In essence, this is a variant of Frogger where you need to use the traffic rather than avoid it, blended with a little bit of strategy to ensure you're maximising the number number of escapees and trying to think two steps ahead.
title: Roland on the Run

description:
A text only adventure, this game sees you take on the role of a bold adventurer who must seek the royal crown within the Dragon's Lair and return it to the King in order to win the Princess' hand.

The journey takes the player through dark forests, dank cemeteries and features all manner of creatures both friend and foe.
title: The Royal Quest

description: This is an interpretation of Othello (also known as Reversi), the classic board game that involves placing counters to capture and enclose your opponent’s pieces inside your own. The counters are dark on one side and light on the other. If a line of counters of one colour becomes trapped between two or more counters of the opposite colour, they are turned over and claimed by the other player. The winner is the player with the greatest number of coloured counters once the board is filled.

sample_screenshots.caption: The CPC is mulling over its options

title: The Moors Challenge

description:
A maze exploration game that requires fast responses as you have battle through various nasties that spawn in each room as you search an old castle for the eponymous treasure.

If you're able to fight your way through all of the challenges, the dragon awaits for the final showdown.
title: Dragon's Gold

description:
An asteroids clone where you need to clear your sector of space of the floating rocks using either your guns or one of your special emergency powers - hyperspace teleportation, 180 degree rotation, reverse thrusting, smart bombing, shield powers or a lucky dip from one of the other five.

Your mission is also being thwarted by invading aliens who will take the opportunity to attack you need to keep on the lookout for an assault from behind.
title: Rock Raid

description:
An arcade-style game with platforming elements, you must try to gather as many gems as you can and dispose of the dragons in the cavern. Fresh dragon eggs are laid by the white queen dragon and you can push an egg off its ledge by walking into it. With some good timing you should be able to use the egg to squash the dragons lying in wait below.

Your character can walk, climb creepers and jump but will lose a life if you're caught by a coloured dragon, flattened by an egg or leap too far from a great height.

sample_screenshots.caption: Better get moving quick before the white dragon gets you

title: Dragons

description:
Fu-Kung is a U.S. Marshall of Chinese extraction who works undercover in Las Vegas in this platform game. This Marshall's particular skills lie in uncovering crooked casinos. To do this, he has to work his way through the hidden complex machinery in each casino, ensuring that the odds can be overcome.

Only if he can get through each casino, without being electrocuted, crushed or falling from a great height will that casino be considered 'clean'. To do this he must study the layout of each casino and discover the best route through each of them.
title: Fu-Kung in Las Vegas

description: Play against a friend in a game of traditional pool bearing the name and likeness of the legendary snooker player. Originally scheduled for release as simply 'Pool', and something of a follow-up to Amsoft's earlier 'Snooker' game, it is heavily based on the same engine with different rules applied to reflect the differences between the two games.

sample_screenshots.caption: Foul Stroke - opening the door for Player 2

title: Alex Higgins World Pool

description: A game of deduction and tactics that borrows heavily from the board game 'Cluedo' with a liberal sprinkling of 'Mastermind'. The game takes place in an English country house, where the body of the butler has been found dumped at the top of the staircase. Each player takes the role of one of the characters in the game, and each of you falls under the suspicion of Scotland Yard. Unimpressed by the police, you each decide to clear yourselves by finding out who committed the crime, the weapon used, the place of the murder and the killer's motive.

sample_screenshots.caption: Time to move to another potential scene of the crime

title: Detective

description:
Taking place over ten racing stages with six different weather conditions, this is a real endurance rally designed to test drivers in all types of driving scenarios.

Your screen view is of the back of your car as it heads along the curving road encountering other uniform cars as it goes. Acceleration is automatic, leaving you free to control left-right movement and the brake. At full speed you approach the other cars very fast. Every car you pass gives you more time to complete the stage while crashing takes a large chunk off your allowed time.
title: Grand Prix Rally II

description: Centre Court is a tennis game for one or two players with an unusual side on view of the action.
title: Centre Court

description: The perennial arcade classic is re-imagined on a 3D game field where players can move their bases along both the vertical and horizontal axis as they look to destroy the invading forces that fire almost continually at you. Fast reactions will be required to take out the enemy forces.
title: 3D Invaders

description:
A one player version of the classic card game that can be learnt in minutes and take a lifetime to master.

Not one for the novice or beginner, this version requires some knowledge of the basic scoring and rules of the game.
title: Bridge

description: The traditional game of noughts and crosses (or tic-tac-toe) makes the leap to the third dimension in this reinterpretation of the classic pen and paper game. Things are a little tougher this time round as rather than having to score three-in-a-row, you need to score a row of four on the 4x4 grid.
title: Cubit

description:
Amsoft's shape shifting mascot returns in the form of a box with legs in this action puzzle game where you must step on each of the collapsing platforms on a single screen in order to progress to the next one.

As well as having to find the correct route around the puzzle, players cannot delay because the platforms will quickly shrink and give out below Roland's feet - take too long to think and he'll plummet to his doom.

sample_screenshots.caption: The second screen - and things are getting tough already, Brian.
Made it!  Now onto the next!

title: Roland Goes Square Bashing

description:
A 2D platformer where you must make your way through the somewhat surreal Scoutland performing all manner of good deeds and proving yourself worthy of membership of the troop.

Good deeds include activities like gathering mushrooms, finding the missing award shields and cleaning windows. It's a dangerous world though and you're given 9 lives to try and navigate the world (plus you can top up from the giant bowl of corn flakes that dominates the landscape).

sample_screenshots.caption: Behold the Cornflake Bowl of Glory
Task 2 - Flag day - scoop them up without getting knocked over

title: The Scout Steps Out

description:
Flight Simulation gives you full responsibility for the take-off, piloting and landing of your plane in a 64,000 x 64,000 grid.

Pilots are tasked with exploring the island and as many landmarks as possible. You are also given a choice of airfields to land at for refuelling.

The game world is represented with 3D vector graphics.
title: Myrddin Flight Simulation

description:
An isometric arcade adventure where the player must find their fortune (in the form of precious metal ingots) scattered throughout a castle and return them to safety.

Taking on the role of a sorceress who can project her spirit, the game has 25 screens to explore with a variety of nasties to avoid or defeat and puzzles to solve. Certain puzzles can only be completed by the sorceress herself while others need to be solved by her astral projection.
title: Doppleganger

description: Taking on the role of Captain King, you must protect the Earth from the seemingly unending waves of marauding aliens from the Alpha Centauri system in this Galaxian style shoot-em-up.

sample_screenshots.caption: On to the second wave and now it's the turn of the Spinners to give me trouble
Loading screen gives you an idea of the points on offer

title: Battle Beyond the Stars

description:
A space trading game where you battle with your opponents for control of some nearby moons that will prove to be the gateway to controlling the galaxy.

The game is divided into threee phases where you battle first over the precious resources that will allow you to mine the moons for their precious resources before you build your satellite and have to launch it into orbit. Depending on the success or otherwise of your rivals, you may have to battle it out with their satellite to establish dominance.

sample_screenshots.caption: The first auction begins straight away
Player 2 wins the auction and gets the first resource delivery

title: Satellite Warrior

description:
3-D Voicechess is a classic chess game with a diagonal-down perspective what gives an impression of 3D view. It is possible to rotate the chessboard by 90° with each press of O key. You may change the colour of your pieces by V key. The voice synthesizer announces all the movements you make. If you would like to play silently, a short chime will alert you that the computer has made a move and now it is your turn to play.

The program has two options: normal play and analysis. In normal play 7 levels are offered, from beginner, when computer responds very fast, to the "correspondence game" level where computer's respond may take up even to 24 hours. Among the different options of the game there are also possibilities to change sides or levels during the game or to stop the game to reposition the pieces. Additionally, by pressing the R key, the computer recommands you the best moves if it were in your place. The program accepts castling and in passing (en passant) capture.
title: 3-D Voicechess

description:
3D Fight is an action game set in space. You are the pilot of an intergalactic combat ship responsible for defending different sectors of the confederation, fighting against waves of powerfully-armed enemy ships.

In addition to enemy spacecrafts, you will need to avoid burning meteorites and kamikaze ships. Some of the ships will try to attack you from behind, but your radar will show you the enemies' position. You can also explore the deep canyons or tunnels that criss-cross the planet. During your mission, you must refuel your ship by destroying the fuel cans placed on the ground. Of course, you should eventually destroy the enemy base.

You can move to the sector that you must protect in order to intercept enemy units or to resupply on the surface of the planets. The bases are located on the surface of the planets. Each planet has a three-level defense system:

  • The magnetic shield: This is the most external protection.
  • The energy screen: This is the intermediate protection.
  • The force field: This is the last protection before reaching the ground of the planet. This level is the most resistant.

These three levels of protection may not be present together every time. To reach the ground of a planet, enemy units must cross all available defense levels on that planet. Once the ground of a planet has been reached, Advenez units will destroy the base (if there is one).

The game has two levels:

  • The strategic level: this is the level where you choose the units that you are going to attack, the planets to defend as a priority, the moment when you are going to resupply, etc. The computer edge provides you with a radar map of the sector and information on enemy units present, on planets and on your interceptor.
  • The action level: after choosing the units to intercept, you must eliminate them.
title: 3D Fight

description: Mountain Palace Adventure is a text-only adventure game where you must enter the titular home to try and find your fame and fortune. However, the area is populated with weird and wonderful characters, making the task harder than it seems at first.

sample_screenshots.caption: Fishing rod in hand, here's hoping we catch a break

title: Mountain Palace Adventure

description:
Big League Soccer is a text-based football (soccer) management game that came along in the wake of the original Football Manager. You get to choose your English club side and are tasked them with guiding from the old fourth division to the top of the first division (this game predates the foundation of the English Premier League).

You're unable to change clubs after you select your team, so choose wisely. After this you have to control the club's finances by wheeling and dealing in the transfer market as well as pick the team that's going to bring you glory.

Although predominantly text based, the game does feature animated highlights for you to watch.
title: Big League Soccer

description:
Hi Rise is a literal platform game where you must paint all of the scaffolding (think Amidar) in a single screen level without the picketing workers capturing and throwing you over the side.

Each structure is something of a 3D maze where you must find the best route to make it around without being caught by your pursuers. The game features 99 different layouts and you can choose which screen to begin on. Once you clear the map, you're given the choice of four exits each of which will whisk you to another level.

To help you on your way, you are armed with two pots of glue that you can drop on the floor and lure the chasing workers into them to hold them for a short period of time this can help you escape or get to an otherwise difficult to reach section of the scaffold. If things get desperate you can even chose to leap to the level below, assuming you can make it. Once the strikers free themselves, your glue is replenished but you're also up against the clock so you need to balance the cautious approach with getting through the level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Getting boxed in, I'll throw some glue down and see if I can sneak out the way.
The first screen and the strikers are in hot pursuit
Warped to the next level and I don't even know where to start here!
The level is virtually complete, just need to get myself into one of these warping platforms.

title: Hi Rise

description:
A combination of text adventure and very light RPG, The Tomb of Kuslak sees you stumbling into an ancient tomb seeking your fame and fortune as you search for Kuslak's sarcophagus which houses untold treasures.

The game requires text input and features battles with werewolves, skeletons and other nocturnal creatures.

sample_screenshots.caption: That axe might come in handy
No option but to descend inside the tomb
My exit is barred - should I stand my ground and fight or turn tail and run?

title: The Tomb of Kuslak

description:
Capitalising on the excitement for the FIFA World Cup of 1986, Loriciels launched Soccer 86 (or quite simply Foot in their homeland of France) in advance of the competition. Despite the marketing, the game does not really follow the format of the World Cup tournament, instead allowing you to choose from one of three European teams (England, Germany & Italy) to play a single match against France.

The game was officially endorsed by Marius Tresor in France, a stalwart of the French defence in the mid-1980s.

One or two players can take part.
title: Soccer 86

description:
Doors of Doom is a 2D arcade adventure with platforming elements where, as the lone human representative on the planet Doom, you must collect all of the pieces of the fabled doors while avoiding the various nasties that can sap your energy and kill you.

Many objects are scattered around the playfield some of which are needed to solve the puzzles and others will help you navigate the world in a safer manner.
title: Doors of Doom

description:
Similar to Berzerk, Renegade requires you search a 10-floor maze for a precious crystal located on the top level and make your way back down with it again – in your path are a number of highly armed guards, and you must find a special object on each floor that will allow access to the one above.

As well as objects that will help you, there are others that will completely rejigger the maze and can sometimes result in leaving you trapped. Guards can be dispatched with your gun or you can simply avoid them.
title: Renegade

description:
Tombstowne is a 2D arcade adventure where you must find and combine objects to solve puzzles, influenced by the later Wally Week games like Pyjamarama. As Sammy Solver, you must search the haunted castle for the pages of a spell book that have been scattered around. Once the book is complete you can must find the cauldron to cast the spell and free the townspeople from the madness that controls them.

You have to collect the pages while avoiding the ghosts and picking up objects that will help you solve puzzles and gain access to other areas.

sample_screenshots.caption: Take the stairway or try to squeeze past the apparition?
Another of the elusive pages lies in wait

title: Tombstowne

description:
Gems of Stradus is a text-based adventure with some basic graphics that finds you wandering around a maze in search of the gems and to claim your fortune.

The game has a two word command parser and is written entirely in BASIC.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hopefully this key will let me unlock the red door in front of me

title: Gems of Stradus

description:
Digger Barnes is a clone of arcade platformer Space Panic, where Digger must climb the ladders and take out the monsters by capturing them in holes that he can dig in the floor.

The game features multiple ladder layouts and changes each time you clear a screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Watch your step, it's easy to fall through your own traps
We've got a monster trapped, just need to finish them off with our pick axe
Death results in your soul ascending to the heavens

title: Digger Barnes

description:
Lucky Fruits is a fruit machine simulation where you can gamble up to £5.00 and try to win as much as you can.

The game has some of the features you would expect on a fruit machine including nudges and a super-spin.
title: Lucky Fruits

description:
Short for Remote Excavation Module, R.E.M. is a clone of Boulder Dash where you control a droid who must clear radioactive material from a playfield while avoiding destruction by falling rocks or the various meanies that populate the area.

The game features a password system for each of its 19 levels so that players can pick up where they left off.

sample_screenshots.caption: Opening level and about to pick up the first piece of radioactive material
In the later caverns you'll also come across some mutant inhabitants who'll get in your way.

title: R.E.M.

description:
A clone of the light cycle section of the arcade game Tron, Life Expectancy Zer0 sees you and your computerised opponent trying to force each other to crash into either the side of the arena or their light trails by cutting down the playing area and trapping them.

Winning a grid will see you move to the next level and an extra computerised player being added to the mix.

sample_screenshots.caption: The first grid and it's still anyone's game
Three computerised players to face up to now, although green is moving to the left and keep themselves to themselves!

title: Life Expectancy Zer0

description:
Jumpman is another in Blaby's series of arcade clones, in this case a variation of Q*bert. It features the same gameplay mechanics whereby you must, as Hubert C. Jumpman, colour all of the cubes on the screen by landing on them. Collect bonus items and avoid your foes who cascade from the top of the screen to the bottom in an unpredictable pattern.

Each of the six levels has its own layout and on completion they will loop back to the beginning with some additional baddies to increase the difficulty level a little.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hubert tries to negotiate the structure

title: Jumpman

description:
The War Game is a strategy game that puts you in charge of either the French or British armies during the Napoleonic Wars with the objective of destroying the opponent's headquarters.

Players can either take on the computer or compete head to head with a friend. You can also opt to rename your armies (although the troops and regiments used will still be accurate for the Napoleonic era).

sample_screenshots.caption: 6am and the enemy forces begin their movements
Carefully placing the troops for the Moby Games army

title: The War Game

description:
Tank Commander blends light exploration with shoot-'em-up action as you take control of a tank deep in enemy territory and must recover your agents kept captive in the area.

Players switch between tactical and battle modes during play depending on if you're moving your vehicle or using it to blast your enemies.

sample_screenshots.caption: Inside the enemy territory, on the lookout for enemy troops
The map gives an idea of the size of the area to be searched
Coming across a tank and we switch to the turret view to try to take them out before they do the same to us.

title: Tank Commander

description:
Ricochet an air hockey game where you need to shoot the puck to make it move and outscore your opponent.

The game is highly customisable with lots of different options available to tweak the gameplay and challenge level.

sample_screenshots.caption: A halo of bullets from Player 2 has the puck headed perilously close to the goal

title: Ricochet

description: Startest is a release title of the German Schneider CPC home computer and includes 5 several games like shooting games or a puzzle, but with cool graphics to demonstrate the graphic capabilities of this computer.
title: Startest

description:
Zania is an arcade adventure game where you must wander a fantasy land filled with many challenges in search of the 'ladder to the sky' and whatever lies at its top.

The game utilises an unusual and ambitious 3D environment where you can walk into the back of the screen and your character's size changes accordingly depending on how close to the front of the screen you are.
title: Zania

description:
You must escape the undersea world through a series of caves and caverns — essentially a large maze. Certain sections of the maze are blocked, and you need to remove the blocks by finding a bomb and placing it at each block.

Beware of everything, because everything can kill you. Also conspiring against you is your constant need for air — luckily, air tanks are placed along the way. You will find money along as well, which contributes to your 'Cash'. It looks like you are carrying a weapon but unfortunately, you are not. Instead, you must duck and weave with good timing to get through the nasties that await!
title: Barrier Reef

description: Deathsville is an arcade adventure game where, as Sammy Solver, you must escape Deathsville before you join the ranks of the living dead that populate the abandoned town. This is a sequel to Tombstowne and follows a very similar style.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game starts in a lightly-wooded area before the danger sets in
Inside the Master's House things are really starting to heat up

title: Deathsville

description:
Halls of Gold is a Lode Runner variant, which at time of release had not yet been ported to the CPC. As in the original game, it is the player's goal to collect all the gold pieces within a level, climbing ladders or handlebars, avoiding deadly falls, and outsmarting enemy guards. The guards can be temporarily trapped in holes that the player can dig. Unlike in the original, there is a time limit to every level.

Also like the original game, Halls of Gold contains a level editor.
title: Halls of Gold
